alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wayne and southwestern Pulaski Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Susie, or 7 miles southwest of Monticello, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cooper around 420 PM EDT. Oil Valley, Parnell, Barrier and Burfield around 425 PM EDT. Monticello, Steubenville and Coopersville around 430 PM EDT. Betsey, Mill Springs, Gregory and Denney around 435 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kidder, Frazer, Delta and Quinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
